    Spring damping of the cloth in the range 0 to 1.

    If the flag PCF_Pressure is set, this variable defines the volume of air inside the mesh as volume = pressure * restVolume.

    If the flag PCF_Tearable is set, this variable defines the elongation factor that causes the cloth to tear.

    Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from cloth to colliding rigid bodies.

    Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from cloth to attached rigid bodies.

    If the flag nx_cloth_attachment_tearable is set in the attachment method of pCloth, this variable defines the elongation factor that causes the attachment to tear.

    Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from this cloth to colliding fluids.
  • float fromFluidResponseCoefficient
    Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from colliding fluids to this cloth.

    If the PCF_Adhere flag is set the cloth moves partially in the frame of the attached actor.
  • unsigned int solverIterations
    Number of solver iterations.

    External acceleration which affects all non attached particles of the cloth.

    Acceleration which acts normal to the cloth surface at each vertex.

    The cloth wake up counter.

    Maximum linear velocity at which cloth can go to sleep.

    Sets which collision group this cloth is part of.

    Sets the 128-bit mask used for collision filtering.

    Force Field Material Index, index != 0 has to be created.

    If the flag PCF_ValidBounds is set, this variable defines the volume outside of which cloth particle are automatically removed from the simulation.

    This parameter defines the size of grid cells for collision detection.

    Flag bits.

    Possible debug name. The string is not copied by the SDK, only the pointer is stored.

    Vertex color to identify vertieces as tearable.

    Reference object to identify the world.

Member Data Documentation

float pClothDesc::thickness

Thickness of the cloth.

The thickness is usually a fraction of the overall extent of the cloth and should not be set to a value greater than that. A good value is the maximal distance between two adjacent cloth particles in their rest pose. Visual artifacts or collision problems may appear if the thickness is too small.

Default: 0.01
Range: [0,inf)

See also:
pCloth.setThickness()
float pClothDesc::density

Density of the cloth (mass per area).

Default: 1.0
Range: (0,inf)

float pClothDesc::bendingStiffness

Bending stiffness of the cloth in the range 0 to 1.

Only has an effect if the flag PCF_Bending is set.

Default: 1.0
Range: [0,1]

See also:
PCF_Bending pCloth.setBendingStiffness()
float pClothDesc::stretchingStiffness

Stretching stiffness of the cloth in the range 0 to 1.

Note: stretching stiffness must be larger than 0.

Default: 1.0
Range: (0,1]

See also:
pCloth.setStretchingStiffness()
float pClothDesc::dampingCoefficient

Spring damping of the cloth in the range 0 to 1.

Only has an effect if the flag PCF_Damping is set.

Default: 0.5
Range: [0,1]

See also:
PCF_Damping pCloth.setDampingCoefficient()
float pClothDesc::friction

Friction coefficient in the range 0 to 1.

Defines the damping of the velocities of cloth particles that are in contact.

Default: 0.5
Range: [0,1]

See also:
pCloth.setFriction()
float pClothDesc::pressure

If the flag PCF_Pressure is set, this variable defines the volume of air inside the mesh as volume = pressure * restVolume.

For pressure < 1 the mesh contracts w.r.t. the rest shape For pressure > 1 the mesh expands w.r.t. the rest shape

Default: 1.0
Range: [0,inf)

See also:
PCF_pressure pCloth.setPressure()
float pClothDesc::tearFactor

If the flag PCF_Tearable is set, this variable defines the elongation factor that causes the cloth to tear.

Must be larger than 1. Make sure meshData.maxVertices and the corresponding buffers in meshData are substantially larger (e.g. 2x) than the number of original vertices since tearing will generate new vertices.

When the buffer cannot hold the new vertices anymore, tearing stops.

Default: 1.5
Range: (1,inf)

See also:
pCloth.setTearFactor()
float pClothDesc::collisionResponseCoefficient

Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from cloth to colliding rigid bodies.

Only has an effect if PCF_CollisionTwoWay is set.

Default: 0.2
Range: [0,inf)

See also:
PCF_CollisionTwoWay pCloth.setCollisionResponseCoefficient()
float pClothDesc::attachmentResponseCoefficient

Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from cloth to attached rigid bodies.

Only has an effect if the mode of the attachment is set to nx_cloth_attachment_twoway.

Default: 0.2
Range: [0,1]

See also:
pCloth.attachToShape pCloth.attachToCollidingShapes pCloth.attachVertexToShape pCloth.setAttachmentResponseCoefficient()
float pClothDesc::attachmentTearFactor

If the flag nx_cloth_attachment_tearable is set in the attachment method of pCloth, this variable defines the elongation factor that causes the attachment to tear.

Must be larger than 1.

Default: 1.5
Range: (1,inf)

See also:
pCloth.setAttachmentTearFactor() pCloth.attachToShape pCloth.attachToCollidingShapes pCloth.attachVertexToShape
float pClothDesc::toFluidResponseCoefficient

Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from this cloth to colliding fluids.

Only has an effect if the PCF_FluidCollision flag is set.

Default: 1.0
Range: [0,inf)

Note: Large values can cause instabilities

See also:
pClothDesc.flags pClothDesc.fromFluidResponseCoefficient
float pClothDesc::fromFluidResponseCoefficient

Defines a factor for the impulse transfer from colliding fluids to this cloth.

Only has an effect if the PCF_FluidCollision flag is set.

Default: 1.0
Range: [0,inf)

Note: Large values can cause instabilities

See also:
pClothDesc.flags pClothDesc.ToFluidResponseCoefficient
float pClothDesc::minAdhereVelocity

If the PCF_Adhere flag is set the cloth moves partially in the frame of the attached actor.

This feature is useful when the cloth is attached to a fast moving character. In that case the cloth adheres to the shape it is attached to while only velocities below the parameter minAdhereVelocity are used for secondary effects.

Default: 1.0 Range: [0,inf)

See also:
PCF_ADHERE
unsigned int pClothDesc::solverIterations

Number of solver iterations.

Note: Small numbers make the simulation faster while the cloth gets less stiff.

Default: 5 Range: [1,inf)

See also:
pCloth.setSolverIterations()
VxVector pClothDesc::externalAcceleration

External acceleration which affects all non attached particles of the cloth.

Default: (0,0,0)

See also:
pCloth.setExternalAcceleration()
VxVector pClothDesc::windAcceleration

Acceleration which acts normal to the cloth surface at each vertex.

Default: (0,0,0)

See also:
pCloth.setWindAcceleration()
float pClothDesc::wakeUpCounter

The cloth wake up counter.

Range: [0,inf)
Default: 20.0f*0.02f

See also:
pCloth.wakeUp() pCloth.putToSleep()
float pClothDesc::sleepLinearVelocity

Maximum linear velocity at which cloth can go to sleep.

If negative, the global default will be used.

Range: [0,inf)
Default: -1.0

See also:
pCloth.setSleepLinearVelocity() pCloth.getSleepLinearVelocity()
xU16 pClothDesc::collisionGroup

Sets which collision group this cloth is part of.

Range: [0, 31] Default: 0

pCloth.setCollisionGroup()

pGroupsMask pClothDesc::groupsMask

Sets the 128-bit mask used for collision filtering.

Default: 0

See also:
NxGroupsMask pCloth.setGroupsMask() pCloth.getGroupsMask()
xU16 pClothDesc::forceFieldMaterial

Force Field Material Index, index != 0 has to be created.

Default: 0

VxBbox pClothDesc::validBounds

If the flag PCF_ValidBounds is set, this variable defines the volume outside of which cloth particle are automatically removed from the simulation.

See also:
PCF_ValidBounds pCloth.setValidBounds()
float pClothDesc::relativeGridSpacing

This parameter defines the size of grid cells for collision detection.

The cloth is represented by a set of world aligned cubical cells in broad phase. The size of these cells is determined by multiplying the length of the diagonal of the AABB of the initial cloth size with this constant.

Range: [0.01,inf)
Default: 0.25

unsigned int pClothDesc::flags

Flag bits.

Default: PCF_GRAVITY

See also:
NxClothFlag pCloth.setFlags()
const char* pClothDesc::name

Possible debug name. The string is not copied by the SDK, only the pointer is stored.

Default: NULL

See also:
pCloth.setName() pCloth.getName()
VxColor pClothDesc::tearVertexColor

Vertex color to identify vertieces as tearable.

Default: 255,255,254

CK_ID pClothDesc::worldReference

Reference object to identify the world.

Default: pDefaultWorld

pClothAttachmentFlag pClothDesc::attachmentFlags

Attachment flags.

Default: PCAF_ClothAttachmentTwoway

See also:
pClothAttachmentFlag
